summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions 955 (1994), 1165 (1998), 1329 (2000), 1411 (2002) and 1431 (2002),
Having considered nominations for ad litem judges of the International Tribunal for Rwanda,
Forwards to the General Assembly the following nominations for ad litem judges:
 
1. Ms. Achta Saker Abdoul (Chad)
2. Mr. Aydin Sefa Akay (Turkey)
3. Ms. Florence Rita Arrey (Cameroon)
4. Mr. Abdoulaye Barry (Burkina Faso)
5. Mr. Miguel Antonio Bernal (Panama)
6. Ms. Solomy Balungi Bossa (Uganda)
7. Mr. Robert Fremr (Czech Republic)
8. Mr. Silvio Guerra Morales (Panama)
9. Ms. Taghreed Hikmat (Jordan)
10. Ms. Karin Hökborg (Sweden)
11. Mr. Vagn Joensen (Denmark)
12. Mr. Gberdao Gustave Kam (Burkina Faso)
13. Mr. Joseph-Médard Kaba Kashala Katuala (Democratic Republic of the Congo)
14. Ms. Engera A. Kileo (United Republic of Tanzania)
15. Ms. Nathalia P. Kimaro (United Republic of Tanzania)
16. Ms. Agnieszka Klonowiecka-Milart (Poland)
17. Ms. Flavia Lattanzi (Italy)
18. Mr. Kenneth Machin (United Kingdom)
19. Mr. Joseph Edward Chiondo Masanche (United Republic of Tanzania)
20. Mr. Patrick Matibini (Republic of Zambia)
21. Mr. Edouard Ngarta Mbaïouroum (Chad)
22. Mr. Antoine Kesia-Mbe Mindua (Democratic Republic of the Congo)
23. Mr. Tan Sri Dato ’Hj. Mohd. Azmi Dato ’Hj. Kamaruddin (Malaysia)
24. Mr. Lee Gacuiga Muthoga (Kenya)
25. Mr. Laurent Ngaoundi (Chad)
26. Ms. Beradingar Ngonyame (Chad)
27. Mr. Daniel David Ntanda Nsereko (Uganda)
28. Mr. Seon Ki Park (Republic of Korea)
29. Ms. Tatiana Răducanu (Republic of Moldova)
30. Mr. Mparany Mamy Richard Rajohnson (Madagascar)
31. Mr. Edward Mukandara K. Rutakangwa (United Republic of Tanzania)
32. Mr. Emile Francis Short (Ghana)
33. Mr. Albertus Henricus Joannes Swart (Netherlands)
34. Mr. Xenofon Ulianovschi (Republic of Moldova)
35. Ms. Aura Emérita Guerra de Villalaz (Panama)
